newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Atlas sees H1 net loss 250 mln pesos.
newsitem.headline: Atlas sees H1 net loss 250 mln pesos.

text.p: Atlas Consolidated Mining and Development Corp is expected to post a net loss of 250 million pesos in the first half of 1997, Zoilo Castrillo, the firm's senior vice president, said on Wednesday.
He said this is an improvement from last year when the loss was 250 million pesos in the first quarter alone.
The lower net loss was due to reduced operating expenses from the retrenchment of manpower, he said.
Atlas posted a wider loss of 1.29 billion pesos in 1996 compared with 952 million in 1995.
Shareholders of the company approved at their annual meeting on Wednesday a plan to rehabilitate its copper mines in central Cebu province, which were closed in 1994 due to mudflows.
Philippine firm Minoro Mining and Exploration Corp has agreed with Atlas to assume its 3.7-billion peso debt from banks and other creditors and later convert this into equity in Atlas.
Minoro chairman Frank Lubbock said Atlas needed at least $140 million to bring its Cebu copper mines back into operation.
